USUAL REGULATORY CRITERION
USUAL REGULATORY
CRITERION

N
subjects for the Test (T) and

Calculate:
Calculate:

Averages of the logarithmic parameters for both formulations
Averages of the logarithmic
parameters for both formulations

By taking antilogs, get geometric means for the two formulations
By taking antilogs, get geometric
means for the two formulations

Take the ratio (T/R) of the two geometric means (GMR)
Take the ratio (T/R) of the two
geometric means (GMR)

Calculate the 90% confidence limits of GMR
Calculate the 90% confidence limits
of GMR

Criterion:
Criterion:

The confidence limits for GMR should be between 0.80 and 1.25.
The confidence limits for GMR
should be between 0.80 and 1.25.

THE PROBLEM OF HIGHLY-VARIABLE DRUGS AND DRUG PRODUCTS (HVD/P)
THE PROBLEM OF HIGHLY-VARIABLE
DRUGS AND DRUG PRODUCTS (HVD/P)

Criterion:
Criterion:

The confidence limits for GMR should be between 0.80 and 1.25
The confidence limits for GMR should be
between 0.80 and 1.25

Problem:
Problem:

With large variation (wide confidence limits): it is very difficult to satisfy the regulatory criterion, unless the number of subjects (N) is very large
With large variation (wide confidence
limits):
it is very difficult to satisfy the regulatory
criterion, c r i t e r i o n ,
unless the number of subjects (N) is very
large

WHICH STUDY CONDITION?
WHICH STUDY CONDITION?

- Single dosing

WHICH STUDY CONDITION? STEADY-STATE STUDIES
WHICH STUDY CONDITION?
STEADY-STATE STUDIES

Comparative parameters, especially of Cmax, have often (but not always) smaller variation in steady-state studies than following single oral administration
Comparative parameters, especially of Cmax, have
often (but not always) smaller variation in steady-state
studies than following single oral administration
